pull.title: lint: upgrade lint scripts for worktrees
pull.body:
Fixes #29972

Use a single script to run the linter locally or in CI.

Works from inside a worktree.

events.body: The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers. ### Code Coverage & Benchmarks For details see: https://corecheck.dev/bitcoin/bitcoin/pulls/34391. ### Reviews See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process. | Type | Reviewers | | ---- | --------- | | ACK | [davidgumberg](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34391#issuecomment-3797308081) | If your review is incorrectly listed, please copy-paste <!--meta-tag:bot-skip--> into the comment that the bot should ignore.

Thanks for improving this, **so** much nicer than the docker command, and it works in worktrees. Because worktrees don't work right, I have been doing `cargo run`, but I have run into a mismatch with the CI linter doing that.

verification.payload:
tree 63de49d3dfbef0c888b2edc419cb61950f6c800c
parent 1b079becf14dd5ba2debf2a5bf90832eb42d5604
author will <will@256k1.dev> 1769170162 +0000
committer will <will@256k1.dev> 1769340440 +0000

lint: upgrade lint scripts for worktrees

Add a ci/lint.py script to run the linter both locally or inside the CI
(replacing .github/ci-lint-exec.py) which supports running from a
worktree.

Determines whether we are in a worktree, and mounts the real `.git`
directory as a read-only volume if we are.

events.message:
lint: upgrade lint scripts for worktrees

Add a ci/lint.py script to run the linter both locally or inside the CI
(replacing .github/ci-lint-exec.py) which supports running from a
worktree.

Determines whether we are in a worktree, and mounts the real `.git`
directory as a read-only volume if we are.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -3,8 +3,14 @@ This folder contains lint scripts.
 Running locally
 ===============
 
-To run linters locally with the same versions as the CI environment, use the included
-Dockerfile:
+To run linters locally with the same versions as the CI environment, either use
+the _lint.py_ helper script (which supports running from a worktree):
+
+```sh
+./ci/lint.py
+```
+
+Or use the included Dockerfile:
 
 ```sh
 DOCKER_BUILDKIT=1 docker build --platform=linux --tag=bitcoin-linter --file="./ci/lint_imagefile" ./ && docker run --rm -v $(pwd):/bitcoin -it bitcoin-linter
comments.body: It seems a bit lengthy, and if the python script is basically calling the same command, maybe this line can be removed from the docs?

+#!/usr/bin/env python3
+# Copyright (c) The Bitcoin Core developers
+# Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
+# file COPYING or https://opensource.org/license/mit/.
+
+import os
+import shlex
+import subprocess
+import sys
+import time
+from pathlib import Path
+
+CONTAINER_NAME = "bitcoin-linter"
+
+
+def run(cmd, **kwargs):
+    print("+ " + shlex.join(cmd), flush=True)
+    kwargs.setdefault("check", True)
+    try:
+        return subprocess.run(cmd, **kwargs)
+    except Exception as e:
+        sys.exit(str(e))
+
+
+def get_worktree_mounts(repo_root):
+    git_path = repo_root / ".git"
+    if not git_path.is_file():
+        return []
+    content = git_path.read_text().strip()
+    if not content.startswith("gitdir: "):
+        return []
+    gitdir = (repo_root / content.removeprefix("gitdir: ")).resolve()
+    main_gitdir = gitdir.parent.parent
+    return [
+        f"--volume={gitdir}:{gitdir}:ro",
comments.body:
```suggestion
        f"--volume={gitdir}:{gitdir}",
```

otherwise:

```
fatal: Unable to create '/btc/bitcoin/.git/worktrees/34391/index.lock': Read-only file system 
```

alternatively, could get rid `gitdir` and just mount `main_gitdir` (without `ro` ):

```diff
diff --git a/ci/lint.py b/ci/lint.py
index ed522c6e90..eff624ce8e 100755
--- a/ci/lint.py
+++ b/ci/lint.py
@@ -25,16 +25,12 @@ def run(cmd, **kwargs):
 def get_worktree_mounts(repo_root):
     git_path = repo_root / ".git"
     if not git_path.is_file():
-        return []
+        return ""
     content = git_path.read_text().strip()
     if not content.startswith("gitdir: "):
-        return []
-    gitdir = (repo_root / content.removeprefix("gitdir: ")).resolve()
-    main_gitdir = gitdir.parent.parent
-    return [
-        f"--volume={gitdir}:{gitdir}:ro",
-        f"--volume={main_gitdir}:{main_gitdir}:ro",
-    ]
+        return ""
+    gitdir = (repo_root / content.removeprefix("gitdir: ")).resolve().parent.parent
+    return f"--volume={gitdir}:{gitdir}"


 def main():
@@ -71,7 +67,7 @@ def main():
             "--rm",
             *extra_env,
             f"--volume={repo_root}:/bitcoin",
-            *get_worktree_mounts(repo_root),
+            get_worktree_mounts(repo_root),
             *([] if is_ci else ["-it"]),
             container,
             *sys.argv[1:],
```

 but this is slightly less belt and suspenders I guess, no strong feelings about that.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,83 @@
+#!/usr/bin/env python3
+# Copyright (c) The Bitcoin Core developers
+# Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
+# file COPYING or https://opensource.org/license/mit/.
+
+import os
+import shlex
+import subprocess
+import sys
+import time
+from pathlib import Path
+
+CONTAINER_NAME = "bitcoin-linter"
+
+
+def run(cmd, **kwargs):
+    print("+ " + shlex.join(cmd), flush=True)
+    kwargs.setdefault("check", True)
+    try:
+        return subprocess.run(cmd, **kwargs)
+    except Exception as e:
+        sys.exit(str(e))
+
+
+def get_worktree_mounts(repo_root):
+    git_path = repo_root / ".git"
+    if not git_path.is_file():
+        return []
+    content = git_path.read_text().strip()
+    if not content.startswith("gitdir: "):
+        return []
+    gitdir = (repo_root / content.removeprefix("gitdir: ")).resolve()
+    main_gitdir = gitdir.parent.parent
+    return [
+        f"--volume={gitdir}:{gitdir}:ro",
+        f"--volume={main_gitdir}:{main_gitdir}:ro",
+    ]
+
+
+def main():
+    repo_root = Path(__file__).resolve().parent.parent
+    is_ci = os.environ.get("GITHUB_ACTIONS") == "true"
+    container = os.environ.get("CONTAINER_NAME", CONTAINER_NAME)
+
+    build_cmd = [
+        "docker",
+        "buildx",
+        "build",
+        f"--tag={container}",
+        *shlex.split(os.environ.get("DOCKER_BUILD_CACHE_ARG", "")),
+        f"--file={repo_root}/ci/lint_imagefile",
+        str(repo_root),
+    ]
+    if run(build_cmd, check=False).returncode != 0:
+        if is_ci:
+            print("Retry building image after failure")
+            time.sleep(3)
+        run(build_cmd)
+
+    extra_env = []
+    if is_ci:
+        if os.environ.get("GITHUB_EVENT_NAME") == "pull_request":
+            extra_env = ["--env", "LINT_CI_IS_PR=1"]
+        elif os.environ.get("GITHUB_REPOSITORY") == "bitcoin/bitcoin":
+            extra_env = ["--env", "LINT_CI_SANITY_CHECK_COMMIT_SIG=1"]
+
+    run(
+        [
+            "docker",
+            "run",
+            "--rm",
+            *extra_env,
+            f"--volume={repo_root}:/bitcoin",
+            *get_worktree_mounts(repo_root),
+            *([] if is_ci else ["-it"]),
+            container,
+            *sys.argv[1:],
comments.body:
Would be nice to add a note documenting this in the README

e.g. just mentioning that you can do:

```bash
./ci/lint.py ./test/lint/lint-python.py
```

not blocking at all, feel free to disregard

@@ -0,0 +1,83 @@
+#!/usr/bin/env python3
+# Copyright (c) The Bitcoin Core developers
+# Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
+# file COPYING or https://opensource.org/license/mit/.
+
+import os
+import shlex
+import subprocess
+import sys
+import time
+from pathlib import Path
+
+CONTAINER_NAME = "bitcoin-linter"
+
+
+def run(cmd, **kwargs):
+    print("+ " + shlex.join(cmd), flush=True)
+    kwargs.setdefault("check", True)
+    try:
+        return subprocess.run(cmd, **kwargs)
+    except Exception as e:
+        sys.exit(str(e))
+
+
+def get_worktree_mounts(repo_root):
+    git_path = repo_root / ".git"
+    if not git_path.is_file():
+        return []
+    content = git_path.read_text().strip()
+    if not content.startswith("gitdir: "):
+        return []
+    gitdir = (repo_root / content.removeprefix("gitdir: ")).resolve()
+    main_gitdir = gitdir.parent.parent
+    return [
+        f"--volume={gitdir}:{gitdir}:ro",
+        f"--volume={main_gitdir}:{main_gitdir}:ro",
+    ]
+
+
+def main():
+    repo_root = Path(__file__).resolve().parent.parent
+    is_ci = os.environ.get("GITHUB_ACTIONS") == "true"
+    container = os.environ.get("CONTAINER_NAME", CONTAINER_NAME)
+
+    build_cmd = [
+        "docker",
+        "buildx",
+        "build",
+        f"--tag={container}",
+        *shlex.split(os.environ.get("DOCKER_BUILD_CACHE_ARG", "")),
+        f"--file={repo_root}/ci/lint_imagefile",
+        str(repo_root),
+    ]
+    if run(build_cmd, check=False).returncode != 0:
+        if is_ci:
+            print("Retry building image after failure")
+            time.sleep(3)
+        run(build_cmd)
+
+    extra_env = []
+    if is_ci:
+        if os.environ.get("GITHUB_EVENT_NAME") == "pull_request":
+            extra_env = ["--env", "LINT_CI_IS_PR=1"]
+        elif os.environ.get("GITHUB_REPOSITORY") == "bitcoin/bitcoin":
+            extra_env = ["--env", "LINT_CI_SANITY_CHECK_COMMIT_SIG=1"]
+
+    run(
+        [
+            "docker",
+            "run",
+            "--rm",
+            *extra_env,
+            f"--volume={repo_root}:/bitcoin",
+            *get_worktree_mounts(repo_root),
+            *([] if is_ci else ["-it"]),
+            container,
+            *sys.argv[1:],
